title: Dirty error message when giving a wrong path for ParseFiles function.
body:
by **14farresa**: 
I'm new to Go, so my apologizes if this is not really a bug, though I believe it is,
because if I give the right path, it works flawlessly.

1) What steps will reproduce the problem?
Compile the following program:

package main

import (
    "fmt"
    "net/http"
    "text/template"
)

func root(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) {
    if r.Method == "GET" {
        i, _ := template.ParseFiles("wrongpath.gtpl")
        i.Execute(w, nil)
    } else {
            fmt.Println("root")
    }
}

func main() {
    http.HandleFunc("/", root)
    http.ListenAndServe(":9999", nil)
}



What is the expected output?
A nicer error message.


What do you see instead?
When accessing / from the web browser, a dirty message appears in the command line:
